Night Shift narrows his eyes. He was caught but he still had a small ace in=
 the hole.  He remembers the finger darts in his left hand, and quickly poi=
nts the finger darts at a pair of eyes on Hydras's dragon head.  Small as t=
hey were, they could still sting like crazy.  He was a pretty sharp shooter=
 with the finger darts, which happened to be one of his most favorite weapo=
ns.  He lets two darts fire, and also saves a couple for Scorponok's eyes a=
s well, with a bit of fancy rapid firing.

" Not if I can help it."

At the=
 same time, he opens his com link to Lord Elder.  Like Tucson he could pull=
 many surprises, but his were more in the form of surprise on board weaponr=
y.

> Scourge nodded slowly as his optics glowed dangerously.=
 "An Autobot
> trying to sneak into the very den of the Predacons, and he h=
oped to
> survive?" he said in one of his longer phrases. "You are prey, pr=
ey
> that will be terminated." Scourge chuckled quietly as he approached to=

> take Nightshift into custody. Scourge typically did not carry stasis
> c=
uff, however his stunner beams were every bit as effective to pick
> off st=
ragglers that the upper echelon did not want slain immediately.

legantly simple move he oriented them on Nightshift and
> fired.

onok smiled as he stepped over toward the doorway that Hydras had
> just en=
tered, in an obvious attempt to cut off any escape by
> Nightshift, Scorpon=
ok's shoulder cannons coming online as they
> prepared to fire should Night=
shift try to flee. "You know, you still
> remind me of another bot." Scorpo=
nok said as he examined Nightshift,
> "Perhaps as we disassemble you we wil=
l see who it is." Scorponok
> chuckled, a knowing grin appearing on his mal=
evolent face.
